During the last decades, the frequency of fungal infections has increased because of human immunodeficiency virus infection and more intensive and cytotoxic chemotherapies
1 . In AIDS, oncology and transplantation patients, Candida still one of the major opportunistic pathogens

Although amphotericin B and its lipid formulations decrease the morbidity and mortality, they must be given intravenously, are extremely expensive and still carry significant infusion-related toxicity. Echinocandins, one of the first-line therapy in neutropenic patients reveal a high antifungal activity against Candida spp
